thread.title: Danny Welbeck reveals he used to ‘hate’ Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs while at Manchester United
thread.title_full: Danny Welbeck reveals he used to ‘hate’ Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs while at Manchester United

author: leeastley
title: Danny Welbeck reveals he used to ‘hate’ Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs while at Manchester United
text:
Comments DANNY WELBECK has revealed he used to hate his Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs. 
The 26-year-old made his breakthrough at Manchester United but moved to the Emirates in 2014 and has become mates with the defender. Getty Images Danny Welbeck has revealed he used to hate Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs Danny Welbeck does the Salt Bae celebration after scoring on his Arsenal comeback 
But Welbeck revealed their first meeting as rivals in a FA Youth Cup semi-final in 2007 - which the striker's goal helped settle 4-3 on aggregate in United's favour - was a less than friendly affair. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Welbeck said: "It was the first time we prepared like it was a first team match. 
"It was a special moment. Obviously me and Gibbo are very close friends now but back then I used to hate him to be honest. Getty Images Kieran Gibbs and Danny Welbeck are now great friends at Arsenal PA:Press Association 4 Danny Welbeck is still getting back to full fitness after returning from a nine-month lay-off 
"He was bigger than me, faster than me, he was so strong and I was like, ‘what is this guy about?'. 
"He scored the first goal at the Emirates. The second leg was at Old Trafford and I scored the winner to knock Arsenal out." related stories YOUNG GUNS Danny Welbeck set to miss Arsenal's FA Cup fifth round clash with Sutton, as he lines up for the Under-23s High Five Arsene Wenger claims he's never had it better at Arsenal than with five attackers he has now Wel rested? Arsene Wenger says Danny Welbeck could be used from the bench as a relaxed-looking Arsenal prepare to entertain Watford Pure Precision Danny Welbeck's stunning opener is crowned the Gillette Precision Play of the FA Cup Fourth Round All's wel that ends wel Danny Welbeck does crazy Salt Bae celebration after scoring twice on his return from injury PA:Press Association Danny Welbeck has made six appearances this season and scored twice this year Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter
